Name: β Cet
Notes: Deneb Kaitos, Diphda, Difda al Thani, Rana Secunda; suspected variable

Name: α Cet
Notes:
Menkar, Menkab, Mekab, Monkar; irregular variable, *V*max = 2.45m, *V*min = 
2.54m

Name: Mira
Notes:
Mira Ceti, Collum Ceti; prototype of Mira variables, *V*max = 2.0m, *V*min 
= 10.1m, *P* = 331.96 d; has a white dwarf companion

Name: η Cet
Notes:
Deneb Algenubi, Dheneb, Deneb, Aoul al Naamat, Prima Struthionum,[1] part 
of Al Naʽāmāt;[2][3] spectroscopic binary, has a planet (b)

Name: τ Cet
Notes:
Durre Menthor or Al Durr al Manthur, Thalath al Naamat, Tertia Struthionum,
[1] part of Al Naʽāmāt;,[2][3] has five planets (b, c, d, e and f)

Name: ι Cet
Notes: Schemali, Deneb Kaitos Shemali; suspected variable

Name: θ Cet
Notes:
Thanih al Naamat, Altawk, Secunda Struthionum,[1] part of Al Naʽāmāt;[2][3] spectroscopic 
binary

Name: ζ Cet
Notes:
Baten Kaitos, Rabah al Naamat, Quarta Struthionum,[1] part of Al Naʽāmāt;[2]
[3] spectroscopic binary; spectroscopic binary

Name: υ Cet
Notes: part of Al Naʽāmāt;[2][3] spectroscopic binary

Name: φ1 Cet
Notes: part of Al Nitham (φ Cet); suspected variable

Name: 13 Cet
Notes: BU Cet; RS CVn variable, Δ*V* = ~0.10m

Name: 39 Cet
Notes:
AY Cet; RS CVn variable, *V*max = 5.35m, *V*min = 5.58m; spectroscopic 
binary

Name: EL Cet
Notes: g Tauri; irregular variable, Δ*V* = 0.04m; multiple star

Name: 44 Cet
Notes: AV Cet; δ Sct variable, *V*max = 6.20m, *V*min = 6.22m, *P* = 0.07 d

Name: HD 1461
Notes: has two exoplanets (b & c) and two candidates (d & e)

Name: χ Cet B
Notes:
EZ Ceti; component of the χ Cet system; BY Dra variable, Δ*V* = 0.05m, *P* 
= 8.92 d

Name: HD 12039
Notes: DK Cet; BY Dra variable, Δ*V* = ~0.12m; has a debris disk

Name: UV Cet
Notes:
primary component of Luyten 726-8, the 6th nearest star system; prototype 
of UV Cet variables (flare stars), *V*max = 6.80m, *V*min = 12.95m

Name: BL Cet
Notes: secondary component of Luyten 726-8; flare star
